评论概述: Here are the extra tools and tips to removing links
评论详情: I needed a hammer, wd-40, box, and small flathead set to remove and then add the pin back to remove links.  Put some indents on the box to help hold the watch in place while removing pins.  Hammer the pin into the 1st segment of the vertical link just to pilot it in place, then line up the rest. Clean the pin and spray with a little wd-40 to help get it back in place. It takes patience to line this up and get it going.  You may need 1.4 or 2.0 flathead to keep the link push led out to maximize the hole opening to drive the pin back back in.  Hope this helps, too my about 30 to 40 mins to remove 3 links and place 2 pins backs in.  Will make a good prop watch for a night out. Will see how long it lasts for $20 bucks.

评论概述: Most Links are not removable at all
评论详情: Tried removing links of watch along with the arrows pointing in the direction in which links can be pushed out, but some of them are utterly impossible to remove. Some of the links come out with ease, and others are immovable. I used the tool that came with the watch, but there is no divot to place the tool into, the huge rods are bigger than the tool. The tool snapped under the pressure immediately. No matter how much force I put into moving the rod in the direction it’s supposed to move it won’t budge. It got to the point where I took a hammer to the tool on the rod (like the instructions said), and the rod still wouldn’t budge. I put all my strength with my hand into the tool on the rod, and it slid off and went right into my finger, causing me to bleed. The watch is in pieces with links getting ripped off of the watch as I tried to move the rod. I feel like it’s just really faulty manufacturing. It should be easier for a rod to move than the it should be for the watch to buckle and break under the pressure it takes to even try to move a rod… designed to move. I don’t know what I expected for 23$. If the rods all moved like advertised, I’d give it 2.5 stars, but now I just have a heap of broken links, and some rods that still refuse to budge. Waste of money

评论概述: Not stainless, can't set time, good for a $20 prop watch
评论详情: Watch is feather weight.  No way it's stainless steel.  Also, the set knob would not work, so it doesn't keep time.  I bought it for a prop for a costume, which is why I only spent $20.  So for a $20 prop that you don't want to use and is mis-advertized as stainless, than it's a good watch.  If you really think you will use it...then it's a hard pass.

This watch is garbage! First thing is that it feels like it's made of tin. It's so light and flimsy it's like I got it out of a cereal box. Second thing is you can't size it like they say in the instructions. The pins are NOT removable! I tried for over an hour and all I did was scratch the watch a bunch. The pins never moved. I found the arrows and used every tool I cool find. I broke every toothpick I own. Thanks I now am out $25 for this trash watch and now I need to buy more toothpicks. I can't return it now because it's damaged... don't waste your money. You're better off going to Walmart or even a thrift store and getting a better watch for the same money. I am beyond mad and I don't care what kind of customer service they have, I won't wear this watch for the fact that this basically a kids toy sized for the hulk, made from recycled tin cans and made by people who have no business around watches.
